author: Charles Curtis
title: Dwyane Wade writes powerful response to Knicks’ treatment of Charles Oakley | For The Win
text:
By: Charles Curtis | February 9, 2017 2:44 pm Follow @bycharlescurtis 
Another NBA star has come out to cry foul about how the New York Knicks treated Charles Oakley on Wednesday night . 
Chicago Bulls guard Dwyane Wade posted this on Instagram Thursday afternoon: A photo posted by dwyanewade (@dwyanewade) on Feb 9, 2017 at 11:02am PST 
10years!!! 10 years Oak gave everything he had for this organization and the image everyone will be left with won’t be this picture. It will be the imagine [sic] of him being taking down to the ground last night in the same arena he gave his all 2 as a player by the guards! This Could happen to any of us!!! #StayWoke We are not above this treatment! 
Wade’s message came after LeBron James’s simple two-word Instagram post seemed to indicate he was throwing his support behind Oakley. 
The takeaway here? For one, players have each other’s backs, especially one who played the way Oakley did for the Knicks . 
But Wade’s post also seems to be pointed at fellow players (“This could happen to any of us!”) — it’s possible one of them could be in Oakley’s position in the not-to-distant future. They could be a star one minute, then pushed aside by ownership the next. 
A powerful take, isn’t it? More NBA!
